Title: BI-Analyst*in
Description:
About

Willst Du gemeinsam mit uns das 36.000 Kilometer lange Berliner Stromnetz fit halten, ausbauen und modernisieren? Willst Du Dich mit voller Kraft für unsere 3,7 Millionen Kund*innen und für eine nachhaltige Stadtgesellschaft engagieren?

Dann unterstütze uns zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als

BI-Analyst*in

im Bereich Kundensteuerung in Berlin.

Wir sind Stromnetz Berlin. Als Mitgestalter der Energiewende halten wir die Stadt am Laufen, geben ihr Energie und bringen sie zum Leuchten.

Mehr über uns erfährst Du hier: Über uns - Stromnetz Berlin

Die Energiewirtschaft rückt Kundenfokus und Digitalisierung in den Mittelpunkt. Bei Stromnetz Berlin steht der Bereich Kunden und Märkte im Zentrum dieser Entwicklung. Die Abteilung Kundenmanagement ist der Eingangskanal für alle Anschlussanfragen auf allen Spannungsebenen. Unser Team steuert diese - standardisiert und digital - durch das Unternehmen. Die ausgeschriebene Stelle ist dabei dem dort angesiedelten Fachgebiet Kundensteuerung zugeordnet.

Nice-to-have skills


Python
SAP
Power BI
SAP
Python
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Data Analyst


Languages


German

Mehr über uns erfährst Du hier: Über uns - Stromnetz Berlin

Die Energiewirtschaft rückt Kundenfokus und Digitalisierung in den Mittelpunkt. Bei Stromnetz Berlin steht der Bereich Kunden und Märkte im Zentrum dieser Entwicklung. Die Abteilung Kundenmanagement ist der Eingangskanal für alle Anschlussanfragen auf allen Spannungsebenen. Unser Team steuert diese - standardisiert und digital - durch das Unternehmen. Die ausgeschriebene Stelle ist dabei dem dort angesiedelten Fachgebiet Kundensteuerung zugeordnet.

Nice-to-have skills

  • Python
  • SAP
  • Power BI
  • SAP
  • Python
  • Berlin, Berlin, Germany

Work experience

  • Data Analyst

Languages

  • German

Title: Senior Data Analyst Marketing (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Marketing Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics. Your main focus will be on supporting your communication platform product team stakeholders which supports global CRM communications in HelloFresh in their decision making. You will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience in analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organisational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Collaborate with Product and Commercial Leads in order to understand the strategic priorities for your domain and then execute against these with engaging work
Partner closely with the Product and Marketing organisation promoting a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour, communication engagement and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.


What You’ll Bring


Strong experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams
Technical Expertise: Proficient in advanced SQL and foundational statistical tests.
Data Visualization Mastery: advanced knowledge of Tableau for crafting compelling visualisations that effectively communicate complex data
Analytical Confidence: Confidence in performing analysis with large datasets while avoiding the common pitfalls
Holistic Analytical Approach: Blend of analytical and critical thinking, complemented by strong presentation and communication skills
Outcome-Driven Professional: Results-oriented with the ability to transform problem statements into actionable analytical insights. Skilled at aligning stakeholders to implement actions that bring value to both the business and its customers
BI and A/B Testing Exposure: Familiarity with Business Intelligence (BI) tools and experience in A/B testing and analytics platforms, including Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Optimizely, MixPanel, etc.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR102678

Title: Data Analyst | Junior PM
Description:
This role requires presence in our Berlin office. Native German skills are a plus but not a must.

🌎 What we do

We build software that helps companies along the food system get to Net Zero.

~31% of global GHG emissions originate from food-related activities. For the first time in history, climate performance has become an overall business performance indicator. Enterprises are mandated by regulatory bodies to disclose their climate performance, which leads to increasing pressure from investors, competitors, retailers, and consumers to prevent and reduce their CO2e emissions. Over the next 10 years, companies have set ambitious reduction targets that need to be met. Enterprise software and new business processes can help.

We raised >€10m in funding in the first 2 years of our existence, we launched our enterprise product, signed and onboarded some of the largest F&B players in Europe, and put together what we believe is the best-suited early stage tech team in Europe. Will you be the next to join us? 🚀

🔭 What you will work on

Your mission

Help our users make sense of their data and pave the way to Net Zero Emissions.

Over The Next 12 Months You Will


Create Actionable Insights for Net Zero
Identify data patterns to help users understand and communicate their carbon footprints more effectively to customers and suppliers.
Turn emission data into clear, impactful analytics for users so they can make better decisions.
Bridge data to real-world measures - our users and farmers don’t live in spreadsheets.
Build Prototypes and Products
Develop models and prototypes to help clients set targets and model Net Zero scenarios.
Develop a strong understanding of our users and their unique challenges.
Work closely with the product team to transform prototypes into scalable SaaS products.
Upskill the Team with Data & AI
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and AI product building.
Empower self-service across teams.
Foster a data-first culture in a fast-growing environment where it’s easy to simply listen to your gut feeling.

🚀 You might be really good for this role if


You have a "get-it-done" attitude and the ability to learn really fast.
You have built products from scratch in the past, be it on your own or as part of a bigger undertaking inside your company.
You were part of the first 1-50 employees at an early stage technology company, no matter in what position.
You understand and care equally as much about the “why” behind the numbers, you think outcome-first.
You are highly reliable and can organise your work really well.


You don't feel like you fulfil all the criteria? We get it: confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But guess what?! There is no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. The only thing you need to ensure along the recruiting process and beyond is that the problem that we are solving with Root is one you cannot wait to get out of bed for on Monday morning! 🤗

🦾 How we support you


You will report to our co-founder Eric


Some of our angel investors that will actively mentor you:

General mentors for product


Vassili Samolis (Director Product @Doordash, ex-Instagram, ex-Pinterest)
Victor Landau (VP Product @cargo.one)


For more technical questions


Pete Hamilton (co-founder & CTO @incident.io)
Tevfik Aloglu (Co-founder @Pyne, ex-BCG DV, ex-Rocket Internet)


For collaboration with design


Jasson Schrock (first designer @Youtube after acquisition, ex-Google, ex-BCG DV)


🎢 Hiring Process

Our ambition is to offer you an end-to-end experience that is fast and uncomplicated - we aim to keep the end-to-end process to 10 working days. We send you prep material for each step and maximise transparency at every step.

Get Mentored By World-class Company Builders

We decided on our cap table with a clear goal in mind: Set our team up for success. This is why we have selected a diverse group of food industry veterans, generalist company builders, and functional experts to join our journey from day 1. Beyond entrusting us with their capital, our angel investors act as mentors and sparring partners for our early team members in their corresponding roles. You will benefit from:


A dedicated mentor with whom you will build your personal relationship
Regular sparring sessions whenever you see fit
Adhoc Q&A where needed


Not looking for a new role but know someone who does?

Refer a hire and get € 1,000 on the hand (or via Paypal if you are more old-school). Just forward the page to anyone that might be interested or directly message our team at hiring@rootglobal.io

_______

Root Global is an equal opportunity employer, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutionsPerform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who we are looking for


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - B2B (all genders)
Description:
Speak our language!




We are Lingoda. Our mission is to empower global talent with the language, cultural and technical skills for integration and success!




Lingoda is a fast-growing online language school for language learners aspiring to provide a human-centric, personalised and seamless learning experience unmatched by competitors. With Lingoda, you're not just learning - you're teaming up with an expert who understands your goals and guides you to success, every step of the way.




Our classes are teacher-led, and supported in- and out-of-class by the latest technologies and a unique curriculum to empower our students to achieve their language goals. High-quality classes are available online 24/7, so anyone anywhere has the opportunity to learn a language with Lingoda.




As a company we bring out the best in people with a positive culture. We challenge ourselves, and we challenge others. We work smart and make it happen. We believe in personal growth and inclusion.




We work hard to contribute to a better society. How? Here are three examples:




• Lingoda’s MATCH network and Global Career Centre seek to upskill and match migrants to career opportunities in Germany, supporting them through government-funded education programs

• In the German healthcare sector, we support international nurses, doctors and midwives to obtain language and professional recognition through state-sponsored education programs. As a result we have become one of the largest educational providers in this field in Germany

• In December 2022, we won “Best Digital Learning Product of the Year” at the Digital Education Awards 2022




We are currently looking for a Data Analyst B2B (all genders) based in Berlin.




Your mission with us:

Working in our B2B Health product environment, you will drive a data-driven culture through engaging stakeholders to understand business goals and ultimately generate impactful insight through creative, understandable and visually appealing deliverables, as well as impactful stakeholder interactions.




Your Tasks:

Partnering with B2B stakeholders to drive operations activity performance and business results through data analysis and business acumen
Driving a data-driven culture through engaging stakeholders to conceptualize and implement KPIs and performance metrics
Formulating strategic recommendations regarding the next steps and calculate business cases for different options and scenarios
Refining, challenging and supporting requests from stakeholders and creating new data analyses based on commonly defined specifications
Becoming a data owner, understanding the data lineage end-to-end
Advising on process improvements and work hands-on, where possible, helping automate reporting




You bring to Lingoda

2+ years as a BI/Data Analyst, with a proven track record of working with operation teams
A Bachelors or Masters degree in a relevant field, such as Information Technology, Data Analytics, Business, Economics, Education Sciences, Digital Education, or similar
Fluency in English (C1), with a German B2 level preferred
Proficiency in SQL (experience with PostgreSQL/Redshift is a plus but not mandatory)Hands-on experience with Tableau and a creative approach to data visualization
Advanced skills in spreadsheets
Python and DBT knowledge is a bonus but not required
Knowledge of GitHub is nice to have
Passionate about data with a strong eye for detail and creative problem-solving abilities
Skilled at working with heterogeneous data and triangulating multiple data sets
Capable of adopting a hypothesis-driven approach to analysis




You add to our culture with:

Your experience with agile methods and design thinking is a plus
You have an independent and rigorous working style
You are a team player and love to think outside the box
You have the ability to understand business challenges and stakeholders' needs




What you can expect from Lingoda

Approachable leaders and transparent communication - every voice counts at Lingoda!
Company events and colleagues who are always happy to socialise + budgets towards team building events!
An inclusive environment with great team spirit and passion for languages
A well-structured and exciting onboarding process to set you up for success!
The possibility to work remotely from your home or in the office located in the heart of Berlin
Learning & development opportunities
Free access to our language classes
Mental Health programs
Corporate benefits & pension funds
28 vacation days per year
Free snacks & drinks at the office
The modern hardware necessary for your work (n.a. for freelancers)
Flexible working hours




Does that sound exciting? Then, send us your CV right away!




We are looking forward to hearing from you!




Your contact person for the position is Sally




We ask that you please apply directly via the link provided in the job description or directly on our website. Due to GDPR regulations, applications sent otherwise will not be considered.




Please note that if you are based outside of Germany that only a freelance contract can be offered. All our contracts whether freelance or regular German employment contract start on a 2 year time period




It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Show more
HTML:
Speak our language!


We are Lingoda. Our mission is to empower global talent with the language, cultural and technical skills for integration and success!


Lingoda is a fast-growing online language school for language learners aspiring to provide a human-centric, personalised and seamless learning experience unmatched by competitors. With Lingoda, you're not just learning - you're teaming up with an expert who understands your goals and guides you to success, every step of the way.


Our classes are teacher-led, and supported in- and out-of-class by the latest technologies and a unique curriculum to empower our students to achieve their language goals. High-quality classes are available online 24/7, so anyone anywhere has the opportunity to learn a language with Lingoda.


As a company we bring out the best in people with a positive culture. We challenge ourselves, and we challenge others. We work smart and make it happen. We believe in personal growth and inclusion.


We work hard to contribute to a better society. How? Here are three examples:


• Lingoda’s MATCH network and Global Career Centre seek to upskill and match migrants to career opportunities in Germany, supporting them through government-funded education programs

• In the German healthcare sector, we support international nurses, doctors and midwives to obtain language and professional recognition through state-sponsored education programs. As a result we have become one of the largest educational providers in this field in Germany

• In December 2022, we won “Best Digital Learning Product of the Year” at the Digital Education Awards 2022


We are currently looking for a Data Analyst B2B (all genders) based in Berlin.


Your mission with us:

Working in our B2B Health product environment, you will drive a data-driven culture through engaging stakeholders to understand business goals and ultimately generate impactful insight through creative, understandable and visually appealing deliverables, as well as impactful stakeholder interactions.


Your Tasks:

  • Partnering with B2B stakeholders to drive operations activity performance and business results through data analysis and business acumen
  • Driving a data-driven culture through engaging stakeholders to conceptualize and implement KPIs and performance metrics
  • Formulating strategic recommendations regarding the next steps and calculate business cases for different options and scenarios
  • Refining, challenging and supporting requests from stakeholders and creating new data analyses based on commonly defined specifications
  • Becoming a data owner, understanding the data lineage end-to-end
  • Advising on process improvements and work hands-on, where possible, helping automate reporting


You bring to Lingoda

  • 2+ years as a BI/Data Analyst, with a proven track record of working with operation teams
  • A Bachelors or Masters degree in a relevant field, such as Information Technology, Data Analytics, Business, Economics, Education Sciences, Digital Education, or similar
  • Fluency in English (C1), with a German B2 level preferred
  • Proficiency in SQL (experience with PostgreSQL/Redshift is a plus but not mandatory)Hands-on experience with Tableau and a creative approach to data visualization
  • Advanced skills in spreadsheets
  • Python and DBT knowledge is a bonus but not required
  • Knowledge of GitHub is nice to have
  • Passionate about data with a strong eye for detail and creative problem-solving abilities
  • Skilled at working with heterogeneous data and triangulating multiple data sets
  • Capable of adopting a hypothesis-driven approach to analysis


You add to our culture with:

  • Your experience with agile methods and design thinking is a plus
  • You have an independent and rigorous working style
  • You are a team player and love to think outside the box
  • You have the ability to understand business challenges and stakeholders' needs


What you can expect from Lingoda

  • Approachable leaders and transparent communication - every voice counts at Lingoda!
  • Company events and colleagues who are always happy to socialise + budgets towards team building events!
  • An inclusive environment with great team spirit and passion for languages
  • A well-structured and exciting onboarding process to set you up for success!
  • The possibility to work remotely from your home or in the office located in the heart of Berlin
  • Learning & development opportunities
  • Free access to our language classes
  • Mental Health programs
  • Corporate benefits & pension funds
  • 28 vacation days per year
  • Free snacks & drinks at the office
  • The modern hardware necessary for your work (n.a. for freelancers)
  • Flexible working hours


Does that sound exciting? Then, send us your CV right away!


We are looking forward to hearing from you!


Your contact person for the position is Sally


We ask that you please apply directly via the link provided in the job description or directly on our website. Due to GDPR regulations, applications sent otherwise will not be considered.


Please note that if you are based outside of Germany that only a freelance contract can be offered. All our contracts whether freelance or regular German employment contract start on a 2 year time period


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.

Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.

Aufgaben

Deine Leidenschaft


Beratung unserer Kund:innen in unterschiedlichen Phasen der Projekte
Analyse von Geschäftsprozessen und Methoden, Aufnahme von Anforderungen und Überführung in technische Konzepte
Entwicklung und Realisierung von Planungs- und Reportingarchitekturen bzw. Anwendungen in den unterschiedlichsten Fachbereichen und Technologien
Konzeption und Implementierung von performanten Datenbewirtschaftungsstrecken
Durchführung von Workshops und Präsentationen



Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Dein Talent


Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)
Ein IT-orientiertes Studium und einige Jahre (3+) Berufserfahrung oder eine klassische Berufsausbildung mit entsprechend mehrjähriger Praxis im BI-Umfeld
Erfahrung im Business Intelligence Umfeld, speziell im Anforderungsmanagement, der Konzipierung und Umsetzung von Reportings und/oder Planungsanwendungen
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in BI-relevanten Sprachen und Technologien, zum Beispiel in SQL, Python, Hadoop, Tableau, Power BI, Cognos Analytics, Planning Analytics (TM1), SAP BPC, SAP AC, Jedox, Qlik
Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Kommunikationsstärke und Präsentationssicherheit
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region



Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!

Benefits

Unser Versprechen

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:


Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.
Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.
Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.
Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.
Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.
Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.
Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.
Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.
Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.



Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 5+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w)
Description:
Die RIB-Gruppe ist der weltweit führende Anbieter von Softwarelösungen für die Steuerung von Projekt- und Unternehmensprozessen in der Bau- & Immobilienbranche. Mehr als 60 Jahre Branchenerfahrung befähigen uns, unser Ziel, die Bauindustrie zur nachhaltigsten und digitalisiertesten Branche des 21. Jahrhunderts voranzutreiben, mit unseren Kunden erfolgreich zu erreichen: „Building Better Together“.

Die Vision, Bauprojekte durch digitale Arbeitsmethoden effizienter und transparenter zu machen, haben wir in den letzten Jahren bei unseren Kunden Realität werden lassen - doch damit geben wir uns noch nicht zufrieden: wir wollen der Bauindustrie die Spitzenposition der Zukunft sichern!

Dies ermöglichen unsere 2.500 Mitarbeiter*innen weltweit; davon > 500 Mitarbeiter*innen in DACH. Als eigenständiges Unternehmen der Schneider Electric eröffnen wir dir dabei nationale und internationale Karrierechancen und sinnstiftende Aufgaben in kaufmännischen und technischen Bereichen. Sei ein Teil davon #ONERIB

Als Analytics-Team entwickeln wir leistungsstarke Dashboards, Reports und analytische Lösungen, die das Herzstück unseres Produktportfolios bilden. Unsere Dashboards sind ein zentraler Baustein unserer innovativen, produktübergreifenden Analytics-Lösung und unterstützen unsere Kunden dabei, schnell und effizient datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Werde Teil unseres Teams als Data Analyst (m/w) und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Softwarelösungen für die Baubranche!

Dein neuer Verantwortungsbereich


Konzeption, Entwicklung und Implementierung von SQL-basierten Dashboards und Reports, die nahtlos in unsere Software-Produkte integriert werden und unseren Kunden fundierte, datengetriebene Erkenntnisse liefern.
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Produktteams als Dashboard- und Datenexperte, um gemeinsam wertvolle Insights für unsere Kunden zu generieren.
Gestaltung und Entwicklung der zugrunde liegenden Datenstrukturen sowie der zugehörigen ETL-Prozesse, die eine stabile Basis für unsere Dashboards bieten.
Definition und Implementierung von Standards für die Datenqualität, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Lösungen hohen Anforderungen an Data Governance gerecht werden.
Arbeit in einem agilen Teamumfeld und enge Abstimmung mit den Produkt- und Entwicklerteams, um unser Analytics Modul und unsere Dashboards iterativ weiterzuentwickeln.


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt (BWL, VWL, Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik o.ä.) oder in dem Bereich Bauingenieurwesen
Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Analytics oder Controlling.
Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL und Datenbankabfragen (z. B. SQL-Server).
Erfahrung mit ETL-Tools (z. B. Microsoft Fabric, Talend).
Kenntnisse in statistischer Datenanalyse (z. B. mit Python) sind wünschenswert.
Kreative Ideen und Begeisterung für die Gestaltung und Weiterentwicklung von Dashboards und Reports.
Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, um effektiv mit unseren Stakeholdern zusammenzuarbeiten.
Sprachkenntnisse: Englisch auf mindestens B2-Niveau und gute Deutschkenntnisse


Was Du Bei Uns Erwarten Kannst

Motiviert durch unsere Werte & Vision, treiben wir die digitale Transformation bei unseren Kunden voran – für ein digitales, effizienteres und nachhaltigeres Ingenieur- und Bauwesen. „Building Better Together“ ist für uns mehr als ein Slogan. Denn neben unseren Kunden stehst du im Vordergrund. Damit du deine Leidenschaft für deine Aufgaben voll entfalten kannst, unterstützen wir dich durch:


einen strukturierten Start: individuelles Onboarding, organisiertes Networking
Goodies wie: Mitarbeitervergünstigungen (z.B. Corporate Benefits), Prämien (z.B. zur Hochzeit, Geburt, Jubiläum), Aktienbeteiligung Schneider Electric, Mitarbeiterevents (Teamevents, Sommerfeste, …), je nach Standort: Tischkicker/ Tischtennisplatte/ Hunde geduldet, Gesundheitsmanagement (z.B. Vergünstigungen im Sportstudio, Betriebsarzt, …),...
ein modernes Arbeitszeitmodell: Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit hybrid zu arbeiten
Karriereentwicklung/ -perspektiven: Team- bzw. Rollenbasierte Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, individuelle Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, nationale und internationale Karriereperspektiven innerhalb der RIB-Gruppe oder Schneider Electric, …
deinen Raum für Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten: proaktives Teilen deiner Ideen/ Ansätze/ Prozessoptimierungen innerhalb des Teams, betriebliches Ideenmanagement, aktive Beteiligung an Meetings auf Team und Managementebene („RIB Town Halls“), …
Wege, wie du nachhaltig sein kannst (je nach Standort & Funktion): digitale Infrastruktur, Company-Bikes, Fahrtkostenzuschuss, eAuto als Firmenwagen


UNTERNEHMENSKULTUR UND WERTE

Motiviert durch unsere Werte kreiren wir eine Unternemenskultur, in der wir ein klares Bild davon haben, wie wir miteinander interargieren, kommunizieren, arbeiten, führen/ coachen, supporten und unseren Nachwuchs fördern. Dabei steht immer der Mensch im Vordergrund!

CHANCENGLEICHHEIT UND DIVERSITY

RIB fördert die Chancengleichheit von Frauen und Männern in allen Funktionen und Tätigkeitsfeldern.

Ganz gleich ob weibliche Führungskräfte, Mitarbeitende mit Behinderung, Berufseinsteigenden oder ältere Berufserfahrene – für uns zählt Engagement und die richtige Qualifikation. Der RIB Code of Conduct beschreibt dabei unsere wichtigsten Prinzipien in puncto Nationalität, ethnischer Herkunft, Religion,…

RIB VISION

Gebäude und Bauten sind für 36% des weltweiten Energieverbrauchs und fast 40% der energiebedingten CO2-Emissionen verantwortlich. Um die Branche effizienter, robuster und nachhaltiger zu machen, entwickeln wir Softwarelösungen, mit denen man im gesamten Lebenszyklus eines Bauwerks Ressourcen, Rohstoffe und Energie einsparen kann. Digitalisierung sehen wir als einen Treiber für eine nachhaltige Bauindustrie. "Building Better Together" steht dabei für das Zusammenspiel der beiden weltweit führenden Prozess- und Energietechnologien: RIB-Gruppe und Schneider Electric.

Unser Manifest beschreibt unsere Überzeugungen und Werte, die uns bei unserer Arbeit antreiben und uns gemeinsam zu Höchstleistungen inspirieren: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lfqlC37lhzk

https://www.rib-software.com/group/impressum

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Als Marketing BI Analyst (m/w/d) im Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team bist du maßgeblich dafür verantwortlich, datengetriebene Insights für unsere Marketing-, Service- und Vertriebsaktivitäten zu generieren und aufzubereiten. Durch die Aggregation, Analyse und Visualisierung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen trägst du entscheidend zur Optimierung unserer Customer Journey, der Effizienz unserer Marketing- und Lead-Generierungskampagnen, der Call Center Management Prozesse und der strategischen Entscheidungsfindung bei.

Was du bewirkst


Durchführung von Analysen der Customer Journey anhand der Global Digital Marketing Daten, um Trends zu identifizieren und Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten
Entwicklung, Pflege und Optimierung von Dashboards und Reportings in Power BI und Google Sheets zur Visualisierung und Überwachung von KPIs
Automatisierung und Optimierung von Datenprozessen und Sicherstellung der Datenqualität durch den Einsatz von Python, SQL und Databricks
Unterstützung des zentralen sowie globalen Marketings bei der Planung, dem Forecasting und dem unterjährigen Monitoring ihrer Ziel-KPIs
Erstellung länderspezifischer Analysen, um Wachstum zu generieren und die Nutzung der digitalen Marketingkanäle in den einzelnen Märkten zu optimieren
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Data Engineering und Data Science Teams innerhalb der Viessmann IT
Aufbereitung von Ergebnissen in Form von Präsentationen, Reports und Zusammenfassungen für relevante Stakeholder


Das bist du


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, BWL, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, CRM oder in einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Kenntnisse in Statistik und Data Modeling
Fundierte Erfahrung mit Tools wie Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks und idealerweise auch mit Python, SQL oder ähnlichen Technologien
Erfahrung bei der Analyse von CRM, Call Center und/oder Performance Marketing Daten
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten verständlich und wirkungsvoll aufzubereiten und zu präsentieren
Selbstständige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und Freude an der Arbeit in einem internationalen, cross-funktionalen Team
Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (mind. Level B2)


Auch wenn du nicht alle Punkte erfüllst, aber bereit für die Herausforderung bist, dann klicke trotzdem auf "Bewerben". Wir lieben deinen Spirit!

Das macht uns besonders

Unsere Mitarbeiter:innen sind der Schlüssel dazu, unsere Vision zum Leben zu erwecken. Basierend auf dieser Überzeugung haben wir Benefits für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen geschaffen:


Dich erwartet eine Festanstellung in einem erfolgreichen Unternehmen, in dem neue Technologien auf eine moderne Arbeitsplatzkultur treffen.
Bei Viessmann Climate Solutions bekommst du 30 Tage bezahlten Urlaub im Jahr.
Du hast als Mitarbeiter:in erfolgreich eine neue Kollegin oder einen Kollegen geworben? Als Dankeschön bekommst du eine Empfehlungsprämie.
Genieße unsere großartigen Exklusiv-Rabatte auf ausgewählte Viessmann Climate Solutions Produkte und Dienstleistungen.
Kleiner Energiekick zwischendurch gefällig? Bei uns stehen kostenlose gesunde Snacks und Getränke für dich bereit.
Für ein gesundes Miteinander: Unser Gesundheitsprogramm bietet einfachen Zugang zu Coachings und Therapie für unsere Mitarbeitenden und deren Familien.
Ob mit Job Bike oder mit Europcar – unsere Partnerschaften schonen gleichzeitig die Umwelt und deinen Geldbeutel.
Unsere Viessmann Akademie und externen Partner bieten zahlreiche fachliche und persönliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten an.
Viessmann bietet dir, wann immer möglich, die Option zum mobilen Arbeiten und sorgt für die passende technische Ausstattung.
Bei uns kommt der Spaß nicht zu kurz, denn bei Viessmann freuen wir uns auf gemeinsame Events, wie unser monatliches Frühstück oder andere Teamevents.
Unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten ermöglichen es dir, Arbeit und Privatleben miteinander zu vereinbaren.
Kita oder Schule zu? Kein Problem! In unserem Eltern-Kind-Raum hat dein Nachwuchs ausreichend Platz und Spielzeuge und du hast einen voll ausgestatteten Arbeitsplatz.


Das sind wir

Wir sind Viessmann Climate Solutions. 1917 als Heiztechnik-Hersteller gegründet, sind wir heute, als Teil von Carrier, ein weltweit führender Anbieter für effiziente und systemische Klima- und erneuerbare Energielösungen für den Wohn- und Gewerbesektor. Wir decken alle Anwendungen ab: Heizen, Kühlen, Lüften, Wasser- und Luftqualität, Energieerzeugung und Energiespeicherung für den Wohn- und Gebäudesektor.

Unser integriertes Lösungsangebot verbindet Produkte und Systeme über digitale Plattformen und Dienstleistungen nahtlos zu einer ganzheitlichen Klima- und Energielösung und schafft so ein sicheres und verlässliches Wohlfühlklima für unsere Nutzer:innen. Alle Aktivitäten basieren auf unserem Unternehmensleitbild „Wir gestalten Lebensräume für zukünftige Generationen‟ und unsere Mitarbeiter:innen spielen dabei mit Leidenschaft eine aktive Rolle bei der Energiewende. Sei ein Teil von dieser spannenden Reise.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Software Company
Description:
📌 Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

📍 Location: Berlin, Germany

🏢 Sector: Software & Technology

💰 Salary: €80,000 – €95,000 per year (DOE)

🌐 Work Arrangement: Hybrid (2–3 days remote per week)

🎁 Core Benefits: Bonuses, stock options, flexible hours, professional development grants, wellness programs, and more!




Language - German Preferred




About the Role

Our client is a fast-growing, innovative software company that specializes in creating cutting-edge AI-driven platforms that help businesses unlock the full potential of their data. Their core mission is to revolutionize how companies leverage data by offering tools that automate processes, predict trends, and provide deep insights, enabling smarter decision-making at all levels of business.




Having expanded rapidly over the past few years, the company is now recognized as a leader in AI solutions across a wide range of industries, including retail, healthcare, and logistics. With a focus on creating seamless, scalable, and customizable tools, their products help companies improve operational efficiency and deliver superior customer experiences. As they continue to grow, they are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join their talented team in Berlin. This position will offer the chance to work at the forefront of data innovation, helping businesses to unlock the power of AI and data-driven solutions.




In this role, you will be integral to shaping the company’s data strategy, providing insights that inform product development, and helping drive the next phase of growth. You’ll have the opportunity to influence decision-making across the organization, as well as mentor junior team members.




Key Responsibilities

🔍 Lead the analysis of large, complex datasets to identify actionable insights that drive business decisions and product improvements.

📊 Design, implement, and optimize data models to support reporting, forecasting, and business intelligence.

💡 Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, and leadership) to identify key metrics and provide actionable data insights.

🛠️ Develop interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar, to provide real-time insights and data visualizations.

🔄 Monitor and analyze KPIs, suggesting improvements to optimize business performance and product offerings.

🚀 Advise stakeholders on data-driven decisions and support them with quantitative analysis for strategic planning.

📈 Mentor and train junior analysts on best practices in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

🔗 Work closely with the engineering team to ensure data pipelines are optimized for data collection, storage, and processing.




What We’re Looking For




🎓 Education

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (Master’s degree is a plus).

🛠️ Technical Skills

SQL: Proficient in writing complex queries for data extraction, manipulation, and aggregation.
Python: Strong experience with data analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy for data wrangling.
R: Proficient in using R for statistical analysis and building data models.
Data Visualization: Expertise in using Tableau to create interactive dashboards and visual reports.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS for data storage, processing, and deployment.
Excel: Advanced Excel skills (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros) for in-depth data analysis and reporting.

💡 Data Expertise

Strong understanding of statistical modeling techniques, including regression analysis and A/B testing.
Experience with machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, clustering, classification) using scikit-learn.

🔧 Experience

Proven experience in automating reports, building dashboards, and delivering business intelligence solutions to monitor key metrics.
Experience working in an agile environment, collaborating with cross-functional teams and managing multiple priorities.

🌍 Language Skills

Fluency in German preferred.
English speaking




Why You’ll Love This Role

🌟 Innovative Company: Join a company that’s leading the way with cutting-edge AI-driven solutions used by top businesses across multiple industries.

💸 Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses to reward your contributions to the company’s success.

📈 Stock Options: Potential to own a part of the company and benefit from its future growth.

🏖️ Generous PTO: Flexible leave policies that ensure a healthy work-life balance.

📚 Growth Opportunities: Access to certifications, training programs, and a commitment to continuous learning.

💼 Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance, dental, vision coverage, and retirement savings plans.

🏋️ Wellness Support: Monthly wellness stipends, gym memberships, and mental health resources.

🍏 Healthy Office Life: Organic snacks, beverages, and a vibrant, collaborative office environment.

🏢 Hybrid Work Environment: Flexible work-from-home options, combined with an inspiring office space in Berlin.

🎉 Engaging Culture: Participate in team-building activities, hackathons, and a company culture that fosters creativity and innovation.




Apply Now

Click apply or send your resume to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com

Show more
HTML:
📌 Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

📍 Location: Berlin, Germany

🏢 Sector: Software & Technology

💰 Salary: €80,000 – €95,000 per year (DOE)

🌐 Work Arrangement: Hybrid (2–3 days remote per week)

🎁 Core Benefits: Bonuses, stock options, flexible hours, professional development grants, wellness programs, and more!


Language - German Preferred


About the Role

Our client is a fast-growing, innovative software company that specializes in creating cutting-edge AI-driven platforms that help businesses unlock the full potential of their data. Their core mission is to revolutionize how companies leverage data by offering tools that automate processes, predict trends, and provide deep insights, enabling smarter decision-making at all levels of business.


Having expanded rapidly over the past few years, the company is now recognized as a leader in AI solutions across a wide range of industries, including retail, healthcare, and logistics. With a focus on creating seamless, scalable, and customizable tools, their products help companies improve operational efficiency and deliver superior customer experiences. As they continue to grow, they are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join their talented team in Berlin. This position will offer the chance to work at the forefront of data innovation, helping businesses to unlock the power of AI and data-driven solutions.


In this role, you will be integral to shaping the company’s data strategy, providing insights that inform product development, and helping drive the next phase of growth. You’ll have the opportunity to influence decision-making across the organization, as well as mentor junior team members.


Key Responsibilities

🔍 Lead the analysis of large, complex datasets to identify actionable insights that drive business decisions and product improvements.

📊 Design, implement, and optimize data models to support reporting, forecasting, and business intelligence.

💡 Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, and leadership) to identify key metrics and provide actionable data insights.

🛠️ Develop interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar, to provide real-time insights and data visualizations.

🔄 Monitor and analyze KPIs, suggesting improvements to optimize business performance and product offerings.

🚀 Advise stakeholders on data-driven decisions and support them with quantitative analysis for strategic planning.

📈 Mentor and train junior analysts on best practices in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

🔗 Work closely with the engineering team to ensure data pipelines are optimized for data collection, storage, and processing.


What We’re Looking For


🎓 Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (Master’s degree is a plus).

🛠️ Technical Skills

  • SQL: Proficient in writing complex queries for data extraction, manipulation, and aggregation.
  • Python: Strong experience with data analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy for data wrangling.
  • R: Proficient in using R for statistical analysis and building data models.
  • Data Visualization: Expertise in using Tableau to create interactive dashboards and visual reports.
  • Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS for data storage, processing, and deployment.
  • Excel: Advanced Excel skills (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros) for in-depth data analysis and reporting.

💡 Data Expertise

  • Strong understanding of statistical modeling techniques, including regression analysis and A/B testing.
  • Experience with machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, clustering, classification) using scikit-learn.

🔧 Experience

  • Proven experience in automating reports, building dashboards, and delivering business intelligence solutions to monitor key metrics.
  • Experience working in an agile environment, collaborating with cross-functional teams and managing multiple priorities.

🌍 Language Skills

  • Fluency in German preferred.
  • English speaking


Why You’ll Love This Role

🌟 Innovative Company: Join a company that’s leading the way with cutting-edge AI-driven solutions used by top businesses across multiple industries.

💸 Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses to reward your contributions to the company’s success.

📈 Stock Options: Potential to own a part of the company and benefit from its future growth.

🏖️ Generous PTO: Flexible leave policies that ensure a healthy work-life balance.

📚 Growth Opportunities: Access to certifications, training programs, and a commitment to continuous learning.

💼 Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance, dental, vision coverage, and retirement savings plans.

🏋️ Wellness Support: Monthly wellness stipends, gym memberships, and mental health resources.

🍏 Healthy Office Life: Organic snacks, beverages, and a vibrant, collaborative office environment.

🏢 Hybrid Work Environment: Flexible work-from-home options, combined with an inspiring office space in Berlin.

🎉 Engaging Culture: Participate in team-building activities, hackathons, and a company culture that fosters creativity and innovation.

Title: Business / Data Analyst*in (w/m/div)
Description:
Du arbeitest gerne authentisch auf Augenhöhe von Mensch zu Mensch?
Dann komm zu uns!
Wir, die Sparda-Bank Berlin mit ca. 800 Kolleg*innen, sind als Genossenschaftsbank im und für den Osten von Deutschland tätig.
Für unsere 470.000 Privatkund*innen arbeiten wir alle täglich daran, positive Kundenerlebnisse zu erschaffen. Unser Handeln und unsere Kontaktpunkte richten sich dabei stets an den Bedürfnissen unserer Kund*innen aus. Banking für, mit und von Menschen!



Komm und bereichere unseren Bereich MarktService in der Abteilung Qualitätsmanagement als



Business / Data Analyst*in (w/m/div)
80 % remote möglich



Hier darfst du dich austoben:



Herausfinden, was Kund*innen wollen, dank Daten und Analysen, ganz ohne Kristallkugel – das ist dein Job bei uns.
Zukunftsfähige und auf unsere Kund*innen bestens abgestimmte Services – dafür analysierst und optimierst du unsere Geschäftsprozesse, nimmst Kundendaten genau unter die Lupe und unterstützt uns aktiv, unsere Kund*innen glücklich zu machen.
Dabei bringst du Daten und Wirtschaft­lich­keits­analysen zusammen, deckst versteckte Potenziale auf und machst Prozesse und Datenqualität immer noch ein bisschen besser.
Klar, dass hier auch der Blick über den Tellerrand mit dazu gehört: Was macht der Markt? Wo liegen Trends? Wie können wir neue Ideen daraus entwickeln? Du recherchierst umsichtig, evaluierst gründlich, was zu uns passt, und bringst innovative Lösungen an den Start.
Damit wir Entscheidungen fundiert und zielführend treffen können, entwickelst du smarte Kennzahlensysteme, die genau die Insights liefern, die wir für unsere strategische Weiterentwicklung brauchen.
Und damit das Ganze nicht bloß hintergründige Daten-Theorie bleibt, baust du mit klaren Dashboards und ansprechenden Präsentationen Brücken zur praktischen Anwendung, die bei Stakeholdern und Teams wirklich Eindruck machen und echte Mehrwerte liefern.



Hier zählt dein Können:



Du bringst ein erfolgreich absolviertes Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einer MINT-Fachrichtung mit oder hast eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Du passt zu uns und unseren Werten.
Zusätzlich hast du bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Business / Financial / Data Analyst, als Management Consultant oder im Controlling mit Umsetzungsverantwortung.
Analytisches Denken und Freude an der Erfassung komplexer Prozess- und (Big) Data-Architekturen zeichnen dich aus.
Du hast fundierte Expertise in Reporting-Tools, wie Power BI, MicroStrategy oder Tableau, sowie in der Struktur von Data Warehouses und bringst gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Excel mit.
Deine Persönlichkeit überzeugt mit einer guten Balance aus Teamplay und Selbstverantwortung und du trittst souverän und kommunikationsstark auf.



Auf diese Versprechen kannst du zählen:



🕗 Flexibilität 🏖️
mobiles Arbeiten ● flexible Arbeitszeiten von 6-22 Uhr (Mo.-Fr.) ● Vollzeit entspricht einer 35-Stunden-Woche ● Gleitzeitkonto ● Langzeitkonto ● Teilzeit möglich ● 30 Tage Urlaub und frei am 24.12. & 31.12.
🤝 Kultur und Werte 🌈
Duz-Kultur ● New Work ● kein Dresscode ● Teamwork und Netzwerken ● Mut und Spaß an Weiterentwicklung ● klares Wertekonstrukt ● #WirSindAnders
💰 Gehalt und Vergünstigungen 🎁
hauseigener Tarifvertrag ● 13. Gehalt ● betriebliche Altersvorsorge ● vermögenswirksame Leistungen ● Urlaubs- und Freizeitangebote ● Zuschuss zum ÖPNV, Jobrad, Kindergarten oder mobilen Arbeiten ● Mitarbeitendenrabatte bei ca. 800 Unternehmen ● Lieferando for business ● Rabatte für unsere Bankprodukte und der Verbundpartner
💭 Gesundheit und Entwicklung 🎓
Sparda Stipendium ● Leadership-Talente-Programm ● Botschafter*innen Programm für Psychische Gesundheit ● Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement



Unsere Zusammenarbeit:



Sparringspartner*innen: Wir sind 10 weitere Kolleg*innen im Team Qualitätsmanagement und suchen nun dich als Verstärkung.
Wir garantieren dir eine intensive Einarbeitung, die remote möglich ist.
Durch regelmäßige Team-Jours fixes sichern wir den kontinuierlichen Austausch und die Vernetzung untereinander.
Wir stehen mit unseren Stakeholdern/Geschäftspartner*innen wie auch untereinander sowohl virtuell als auch in Präsenz im Kontakt. Dadurch entsteht für dich Flexibilität in der Wahl deines Arbeitsorts.



So geht es für dich weiter:



Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, kultureller und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter oder geschlechtlicher Identität. Auf ein Foto bei deiner Bewerbung kannst du daher gerne verzichten. Wenn du uns in unserer Vielfalt ergänzen magst, bewirb dich – du bist herzlich willkommen! 

Dein Kontakt ist unsere Personalreferentin Recruiting Melanie Brückmann, Tel. 0170 24 66 286.







Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Pricing
Description:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.

Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.

Aufgaben


Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.
Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.
Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.
Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.



Qualifikation


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.
Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.
Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).
Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.
Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.
Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.



Benefits


Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen
30 Urlaubstage
Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)
Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning
Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche
Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern
Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten
Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr



Gestalte mit uns das neue Gesund! Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!

Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more
